thread.title: Abortion proponents complain after new videos posted online
thread.title_full: Abortion proponents complain after new videos posted online - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Abortion proponents complain after new videos posted online
text:
By ALAN FRAM
Associated Press WASHINGTON (AP) - A trade group for abortion providers says the online posting of secret videos by a conservative blogger could put abortion clinic workers in jeopardy.
The National Abortion Federation says the videos were recorded at its meetings by the Center for Medical Progress. The center's furtive recordings of Planned Parenthood officials discussing their retrieval of fetal tissue have sparked an uproar by conservatives.
The federation obtained a court order in San Francisco against public release of footage recorded at its recent gatherings. But videos have been posted online at a conservative website, GotNews.com.
Website founder Charles C. Johnson says on his site that he believes the court order does not apply to him.
The federation says releasing more videos "will likely lead to more threats, intimidation and possibly violence."
